article_title: Foyle's War on PBS; Sleepy Hollow and Brooklyn Nine-Nine on Fox: Television Reviews by Nancy deWolf Smith
article_text:
The new season of "Foyle's War" could be the best ever. That's saying a lot, because World War II—the backdrop and co-star for so long of the period drama about a British detective in Hastings—is over. In effect, we now have Foyle's Cold War. (Think "Tinker Tailor Soldier Spy," with everything more illuminated.)

The mists of time are descending over that conflict, too, bringing a pleasing nostalgia factor. But it is also a source of stories full of intrigue and duplicity, and many layers of moral...

twitter.description: In The Wall Street Journal, TV columnist Nancy deWolf Smith says Detective Christopher Foyle is better than ever battling spies and moral murkiness in postwar London; while Ichabod Crane brings excitement to the town of Sleepy Hollow.
twitter.title: A Reluctant Cold Warrior
